page.title: 04ROADS AND TRANSPORT. TREDIS
page.content: Public Transport in the area is sparse.There is a return Western National Ferry Bus to Plymouth once daily along the coast road,and Polbathic has a once-weekly service by Western National Buses.The Downderry Retirement Club runs a shopping bus once a month.People working in Plymouth have to use private cars via Torpoint Ferry or Tamar Bridge. The roads are narrow and mainly unclassified,except for the A38 trunk road through Polbathic which takes average 300 vehicles per hour.B3247N links Downderry with the A38;B3247E leads to Plymouth via Torpoint,thus these roads are busy twice daily,and also carry lorry traffic.Otherwise traffic is mainly agricultural or summer tourist. Roads are kept in good order by the County Council.{
